Articles.Content:
Any time I try to complete a search on the forum, I get an HTTP 500 error.

For example, when I try to search for SETI:
https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/search/&q=SETI

 

Anyone else having the same problem?
I too haven't found the forum search function to be of much utility.
The forum seach, which used to work fine, hasn't returned useful results for me in several months. So I've been using Google instead in the period.

Just a note to those who are using google, If you are searching for SETI on the KSP forums, use "SETI site:forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com" to restrict your search to only the KSP forums.  I know some forum software that uses that by default for in house searches, as ya know, google kinda perfected the search engine thingy.
Moving to Kerbal Network, since this is about the forum rather than KSP itself.

17 hours ago, purpleivan said:

The forum seach, which used to work fine, hasn't returned useful results for me in several months. So I've been using Google instead in the period.

while I'm not getting errors, I also haven't really been able to get useful results from searches.  Often, if I search for a mod's name, the actual mod's thread will be pages and pages back behind a deluge of other threads where it might be mentioned once.

Edited May 24, 2018 by Capt. Hunt
